text:
I was excited to watch this video about Commerce Hub going international.

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y3CLtckxT10|Commerce Hub Goes International | HubSpot Admins HUG | 02.06.24>

There’s some really useful stuff in there and having it available in the UK is a good thing.

<@U04U9UFTKNJ> draws attention to the difference between B2B and B2C here, and goes on to explain that they haven’t really seen “carts” being a feature that is in much demand or on the roadmap. Now - maybe it’s the luck of the draw of clients and projects - but most HubSpot + ecommerce solutions I’ve either worked on or seen cross our path at least, have wanted some way of automatically configuring a payment link or quote with line items based on a users’ actions and choices. Eg, a cart in all but name.

Our experience at least, is that clients expect that HubSpot can figure this out before someone in Sales needs to get involved to manually communicate with a customer to generate a quote/payment link etc.

I understand that B2C wont be a focus for HubSpot, but I’d like to just get my voice out here and say - please - when it comes to the API - letting developers create and manage payment links at least, could be an absolute game-changer. With the ability to do that alone, it’s reasonably trivial for developers to then facilitate a cart-like functions using a combo of HubSpot Memberships, Custom Objects and/or Local Storage.

Give us that - and I think we would never need to darken our days with the likes of Shopify ever again.

Really exciting to see this update though. I think what’s been done with recurring payments/subscription features etc is going to be huge. :+1:

Future change for the Blog Author Bios: My team would love to be able to edit/add a field to the Author bio template.
They want to be able to add a "title" field that will appear on the Author Detail pages. I'm sure other fields would be handy to have as well.
